contextId.information: This is a generalization. AT: "all over the land of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: within all the borders of Israel
all his brothers ... all the men

contextId.information: This is hyperbole for not knowing anything about what he is supposed to do. AT: "I do not know the right way to do things" or "I do not know how to be the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: I do not know how to go out or come in

contextId.information: This may refer either 1) to the people whom Solomon called to Jerusalem and who are listed in 8:1 or 2) generally to those who traveled to Jerusalem for the feast, not necessarily to every male person who lived in Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

These generalizations may refer either 1) to the people whom Solomon called to Jerusalem and who are listed in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:01|8:1]], or 2) to those who traveled to Jerusalem for the feast, not necessarily to every person who lived in Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: all Israel with him ... all the people of Israel

contextId.information: This generalization may refer either 1) to the people whom Solomon called to Jerusalem and who are listed in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:01|8:1]], or 2) to those who traveled to Jerusalem for the feast, not necessarily to every person who lived in Israel. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:62|8:62]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
This is a generalization. AT: "People from everywhere" or "People from many different places" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

The narrator uses hyperbole to emphasize the great amount of silver that was in Jerusalem. AT: "The king had so much silver in Jerusalem, it was like there was as much silver as there was stones on the ground" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: The king had silver in Jerusalem, as much as the stones on the ground

contextId.information: This is a generalization that means the people of Israel buried him and mourned for him. AT: "A great number of the people of Israel were present when people buried him, and the people of Israel mourned for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: All Israel buried him and mourned for him

contextId.information: This is likely to be an exaggeration that indicates there were many places like these for false worship all over the country. AT: "on the high hills and under the green trees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: on every high hill and under every green tree

contextId.information: This is a generalization that indicates every valuable thing that could be found was taken away. AT: "He took away many valuable things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

This is a generalization to refer to the leaders and people who represent the ten tribes of the northern kingdom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "I" is repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
